answer.content:
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Graph Visualization</title>
    <style>
        body {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            height: 100vh;
            margin: 0;
            background-color: #f0f0f0;
        }
        canvas {
            border: 1px solid #ccc;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <canvas id="graphCanvas" width="600" height="400"></canvas>
    <script>
        const canvas = document.getElementById('graphCanvas');
        const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');

        const graph = {
            nodes: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E'],
            edges: [
                { from: 'A', to: 'C' },
                { from: 'B', to: 'C' },
                { from: 'C', to: 'D' },
                { from: 'A', to: 'D' },
                { from: 'D', to: 'E' },
            ],
            isDirected: false // Change to true for a directed graph
        };

        const nodePositions = {};
        const radius = 20;

        function drawNode(x, y, label) {
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.arc(x, y, radius, 0, Math.PI * 2);
            ctx.fillStyle = '#fff';
            ctx.fill();
            ctx.strokeStyle = '#000';
            ctx.stroke();
            ctx.fillStyle = '#000';
            ctx.font = '15px Arial';
            ctx.textAlign = 'center';
            ctx.textBaseline = 'middle';
            ctx.fillText(label, x, y);
        }

        function drawEdge(from, to) {
            const { x: x1, y: y1 } = nodePositions[from];
            const { x: x2, y: y2 } = nodePositions[to];
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.moveTo(x1, y1);
            ctx.lineTo(x2, y2);
            ctx.strokeStyle = '#000';
            ctx.stroke();

            if (graph.isDirected) {
                drawArrow(x1, y1, x2, y2);
            }
        }

        function drawArrow(fromx, fromy, tox, toy) {
            const headlen = 10; // length of head in pixels
            const dx = tox - fromx;
            const dy = toy - fromy;
            const angle = Math.atan2(dy, dx);
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.moveTo(tox, toy);
            ctx.lineTo(tox - headlen * Math.cos(angle - Math.PI / 6), toy - headlen * Math.sin(angle - Math.PI / 6));
            ctx.lineTo(tox - headlen * Math.cos(angle + Math.PI / 6), toy - headlen * Math.sin(angle + Math.PI / 6));
            ctx.lineTo(tox, toy);
            ctx.closePath();
            ctx.fillStyle = '#000';
            ctx.fill();
        }

        function initGraph() {
            const stepAngle = (2 * Math.PI) / graph.nodes.length;
            const centerX = canvas.width / 2;
            const centerY = canvas.height / 2;
            const bigRadius = 150;

            graph.nodes.forEach((node, index) => {
                const x = centerX + bigRadius * Math.cos(stepAngle * index);
                const y = centerY + bigRadius * Math.sin(stepAngle * index);
                nodePositions[node] = { x, y };
                drawNode(x, y, node);
            });

            graph.edges.forEach(({ from, to }) => drawEdge(from, to));
        }

        initGraph();
    </script>
</body>
</html>

messages.content: Generate a single HTML file with JavaScript demonstrating the user-given concept. Only respond in a single HTML file.
